location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, to Thomas Hodges, President and Governor at Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is an update of affairs at Bushire and the Gulf. Various subjects are discussed:the dispute between Carim Caun [Karim Khan] and the Sheikhs of Bushire, which has led to the former imposing a blockade around Bushire;Sheikh Sa‘dūn's plan to travel to Schyrass [Shiraz] to pay tribute to the Khan and the hope that this might settle things;reports of English ships seen further south, heading in the direction of Muscat, that are believed to have survivors from the Defiance, which blew up the previous month, on board.
